attributes.title: Metabolic Bone Disease Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
This clinic treats patients who have metabolic bone conditions such as thin, thick, soft, brittle or irregular bones—diseases caused by problems with mineral metabolism, nutrition or genetic disorders.

We also see patients with hyperparathyroidism, hypercalcemia, hypophosphatemia, hypophosphatasia, fibrous dysplasia and low bone density. Many of these diseases lead to fractures of the bones. Our goal is to prevent fractures and reduce bone pain.

The Metabolic Bone Disease Clinic measures bone density (DEXA) and offers additional diagnostic services for patients suffering from diseases such as osteoporosis.

Our multidisciplinary team provides nutritional advice, medications, physical therapy and prevention education to prevent falls and fractures. Surgery is sometimes recommended, in which case we partner with our patients and colleagues in orthopedic surgery to make the bone stronger so that surgery will be more successful.

attributes.title: Radiology Services at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Advanced imaging and diagnostic services in North Seattle

Northwest Hospital & Medical Center is equipped with the most advanced diagnostic imaging technology available. Our board-certified radiologists have specialty training in cardiac imaging, neuro-imaging, musculoskeletal, interventional radiology, nuclear medicine and body and breast imaging. Along with our team of expert imaging technologists, they are committed to diagnosing illnesses and injuries quickly and effectively so treatment can begin.

We take time and attention with each patient to explain procedures so you’ll know what to expect every step of the way.

Radiology Services at Northwest offers routine radiology, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), computed tomography (CT), ultrasound, nuclear medicine, interventional radiology and cardiac stress tests and monitoring.

attributes.title: Radiology Services at Harborview

body.value:
Advanced diagnostic imaging, specialized clinical expertise

Radiology Services at Harborview Medical Center offers a full complement of radiology tests and imaging procedures, including nuclear medicine and interventional radiology (angiography). Many modalities have same-day and next-day availability.

All of UW Medicine’s radiologists are board-certified and sub-specialized in a variety of areas such as neuroradiology, body radiology, interventional radiology, musculoskeletal radiology, ultrasound, nuclear medicine, mammography, chest radiology and more. Imaging findings are integrated with all clinical data to generate comprehensive and actionable patient assessments.

Reports and images seamlessly integrate with your UW Medicine electronic medical record (eCare) and are available to you and your care provider shortly after the exam has been completed.

attributes.title: Radiology Services at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Comprehensive imaging services in Bellevue

Our expert technologists at the UW Medicine Eastside Specialty Center use the latest and most advanced technology for CT, MRI, radiography, mammography, bone density and ultrasound. We offer walk-in X-ray and have same- and next-day appointments available.

With free parking and easy access off I-405 and WA-520, our Bellevue location is right in your neighborhood for convenient, outpatient services in a warm and comfortable setting.

A radiologist is on site for patient questions, and examinations are interpreted by a team of highly skilled, sub-specialized UW Medicine radiologists.

Reports and images seamlessly integrate with your UW Medicine electronic medical record (eCare) and are available to you and your care provider shortly after the exam has been completed.

Clinic hours vary by modality:

  • Computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): Monday and Tuesday, 8 a.m.-5:30 p.m. and Wednesday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m.
  • Ultrasound: Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-4​:30 p.m.​
  • Radiography (X-ray): Monday and Tuesday, 7 a.m.-6 p.m. and Wednesday-Friday, 7 a.m.-5 p.m.

Additional details on modalities: 

  • Computed Tomography (CT): 64-slice, ultra-low-dose, high-resolution scanner. Same- and next-day availability. Download CT screening form.
  • Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI): All-digital, industry-leading technology with a wide array of specialized coils for different applications. Same- and next- day availability. Download MRI screening form.
  • Mammography (Digital Breast Tomosynthesis): 3D screening technology allows imaging of breast tissue in greater detail, one layer at a time.
  • Ultrasound (US): New 3D and 4D (3D in real-time) equipment with full-featured probes. Same- and next-day availability. 
  • Radiography (X-ray): Direct-digital, high-resolution technology with tomosynthesis and dual-energy capability. Same- and next-day availability. 
  • DEXA (Dual energy X-Ray absorptiometry): Bone bensitometry uses a very small dose of ionizing radiation.

attributes.title: Radiology Services at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Complete radiology and imaging services using the latest technology

Radiology Services at the University of Washington Medical Center is the premier choice for imaging in the Pacific Northwest. Our combination of expertise, service and commitment to providing the latest imaging technology offers comprehensive diagnostic support for you and your family.

From basic screening tests to cutting-edge procedures, our state-of-the art equipment, skilled technologists and diverse, world-class academic radiologists deliver timely, accurate results.

All of UW Medicine’s radiologists are board-certified and specialize in a variety of areas such as neuroradiology, body radiology, interventional radiology, musculoskeletal radiology, ultrasound, nuclear medicine, mammography and chest radiology. Imaging findings are integrated with all clinical data to generate comprehensive and actionable patient assessments.

We also offer a full complement of heart-related cardiac diagnostic imaging tests and procedures, including electrocardiogram (for neonatal and pediatric patients) and echocardiography services, CT and MRI imaging services and nuclear imaging services.

Reports and images seamlessly integrate with your UW Medicine electronic medical record (eCare) and are available to you and your care provider shortly after the exam has been completed.

attributes.title: Sports Concussion Program at Harborview

body.value:
Critical evaluation and care for athletes of all ages

A concussion can be a serious health problem, and it requires immediate recognition and proper management. In collaboration with Seattle Children’s, the Sports Concussion Program at Harborview Medical Center provides children, teen and adult athletes with evaluation, treatment and medical clearance to return to sports.

Our team includes healthcare providers skilled in rehabilitation medicine, neurological surgery, neuropsychology, sports medicine and radiology and imaging services.

We also provide educational resources about concussion prevention and treatment for parents, trainers, athletes, athletic directors and others involved in youth sports.

attributes.title: Sports Medicine Center at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Comprehensive care for athletes and weekend warriors

Located in Bellevue, the Sports Medicine Center at Eastside Specialty Center offers a full range of sports medicine services to athletes and other individuals of all ages and abilities in a convenient, comfortable and patient-friendly setting.

We have specialists in musculoskeletal radiology, orthopedic surgery, physical therapy, rehabilitation medicine and sports medicine. Our services include thorough, non-operative and surgical care, diagnostic imaging, musculoskeletal ultrasound, physical therapy and rehabilitation.

Whether you’re suffering from a musculoskeletal injury or simply want to improve your performance, our specialists will help get you back on top of your game.

attributes.title: Rheumatology Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Lupus and complex rheumatologic disease care on Roosevelt

The Rheumatology Clinic at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt provides consultation, evaluation and treatment for a wide range of systemic diseases and related conditions, including rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, vasculitis, polyarthritis, psoriatic arthritis, Sjogren's syndrome, scleroderma, myositis, lupus and giant cell arteritis.

We specialize in complex rheumatologic diseases, especially lupus—and we offer a monthly lupus clinic. We also have expertise in treating rhematologic disease associated with interstitial lung disease and offer a specialized musculoskeletal ultrasound clinic for advanced diagnostics and therapy.

attributes.title: The Seattle Arthritis Clinic at Northwest

body.value:
Specialized arthritis and rheumatology care in North Seattle

The Seattle Arthritis Clinic at Northwest Hospital’s Outpatient Medical Center is a multidisciplinary clinic comprised of experts specializing in the medical diagnosis and treatment of musculoskeletal and inflammatory illnesses, including rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, osteoporosis and many others.

In addition to board-certified rheumatologists, our care team includes rheumatology nurse practitioners, a mental health counselor, psychologist and a nutritionist who all work together to care for you as a whole person.

Diagnostic tools available in the office include ultrasound, X-ray, bone density scans and lab tests. Our team is committed to empowering, patient-centered care focused on preventing tissue destruction and improving function. We are committed to helping you manage your illness through education, coaching and care coordination.

In addition to comprehensive, on-site laboratory and imaging services, we offer a specialized musculoskeletal ultrasound clinic for advanced diagnostics and therapy.

attributes.title: Brain Injury Rehabilitation at UWMC

body.value:
Comprehensive rehabilitation care for brain injury caused by trauma or disease

The neuro-rehabilitation program at the Brain Injury Rehabilitation Clinic at UWMC provides comprehensive outpatient treatment services for people ages 16 and older with acquired brain injury as a result of trauma, stroke, tumor and multiple sclerosis.

Our services include physiatry, neuropsychology, rehabilitation psychology, rehabilitation counseling, speech pathology, occupational therapy and physical therapy.

Our team focuses on improving independence in the home and the ability to return to more productive activity, such as work or school. Treatment addresses cognitive, physical and emotional/behavioral changes related to brain injury through individual and, in some cases, group formats.

attributes.title: Inpatient Rehabilitation Unit at Harborview

body.value:
Comprehensive patient- and family-centered rehabilitation care at Harborview

Harborview Medical Center’s Inpatient Rehabilitation Unit is a 24-bed inpatient trauma rehabilitation unit dedicated to providing the highest quality of care to individuals who have sustained a traumatic injury requiring inpatient rehabilitation. Primary patient populations that we serve are spinal cord injury, traumatic brain injury, and stroke patients.

Our staff—which includes rehabilitation physicians, psychologists, nurses, physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech language pathologists, recreation therapists, social workers and care managers—works together to provide the most advanced and effective rehabilitative treatments to maximize your functional skills after a traumatic injury or stroke.

Each patient collaborates with the multidisciplinary team to set goals for their inpatient rehabilitation experience that address their unique situation and aspirations. The intensive therapy programming during your stay will be focused on your goals and will help you maximize your independence, educate you about your injury, optimize your recovery and return you to a dignified, satisfying and productive life.

Referrals for consideration of admission should be directed to:  Rehab Admissions Coordinator at 206-744-4607 PHONE;  206-744-5422 FAX. 

Harborview Inpatient Rehabilitation Unit admission criteria can be found here.

Conveniently located at UW Medical Center, specialists at the Rehabilitation Unit provide expert care to patients with a wide variety of medical conditions, injuries and illnesses. Our goal is to maximize your potential and help you achieve as much independence as possible.

attributes.title: Sleep Medicine Center at Harborview

body.value:
Comprehensive sleep disorder diagnosis, treatment and follow-up services at Harborview and beyond

Located in the Ninth and Jefferson Building at Harborview Medical Center, the UW Medicine Sleep Center provides multidisciplinary assessment, treatment and follow-up consultation services for patients with suspected or diagnosed sleep-related problems, covering the full spectrum of sleep disorders, including sleep apnea, narcolepsy, insomnia, restless leg syndrome/periodic limb movement disorder and circadian rhythm abnormalities.

Our primary clinic is located at Harborview and includes our main sleep testing facility and sleep medicine clinic. Our team also sees patients at the Sleep Medicine Clinic at UW Medical Center, Otolaryngology Head and Neck Surgery Clinic at Harborview and at UW Medicine Neighborhood Clinics in Shoreline, Federal Way, Issaquah, Kent/Des Moines and Woodinville, as well as at the General Pulmonary Clinic and Regional Heart Center, both at UW Medical Center.

We also have satellite sites, which provide home sleep apnea testing in Bellevue at the Eastside Specialty Center, Federal Way and Shoreline.

attributes.title: Heart Center at Seattle Children's
Neuromuscular Respiratory Failure Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Internationally-recognized care for neuromuscular-related respiratory failure

The Neuromuscular Respiratory Failure Clinic at UW Medical Center stands alone as the only clinic of its kind, offering care for neuromuscular breathing issues for patients across Washington, Wyoming, Alaska, Montana and Idaho.

A UW Center of Excellence, we’re a nationally- and internationally-recognized clinic. We’ve treated patients with neuromuscular disease for more than 25 years, and we’ve developed pioneering care for neuromuscular respiratory failure. We approach each person’s breathing issues in a holistic way and focus on quality of life.

We offer consultation and evaluation for patients with neuromuscular diseases like amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, diaphragmic paralysis, kyphoscoliosis, multiple sclerosis, muscular dystrophy, myotonic dystrophy, polymyostitis, post-polio syndrome and spinal cord injury. We also provide training for patients who need in-home ventilation, including the use of bipap and mask fitting, mouthpiece ventilation and cough-assist devices.

We collaborate with the Muscular Dystrophy Association and work closely with board-certified UW Medicine providers, including respiratory therapists and specialists in neuromuscular disease, neurology and rehabilitation medicine.

Please note: We see patients in clinic on Tuesdays from 1p.m.-5 p.m. and Fridays from 8 a.m.- 12 p.m., but take patient calls Monday through Friday from 8 a.m.-5 p.m.

attributes.title: Center for Interstitial Lung Diseases at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Thorough evaluations, accurate diagnosis and management of acute and chronic interstitial lung diseases at UW Medical Center

Interstitial lung disease is the name for a complex and wide variety of lung disorders of known and unknown causes, comprised of over 200 clinical conditions. These are inflammatory fibrotic lung diseases, and most of them are incurable but treatable. Those who progress despite treatment may need lung transplantation.

The Center for Interstitial Lung Disease at UW Medical Center provides complete diagnostic evaluations and disease management for patients with ILD at all stages, including pre-lung transplant evaluation and transition to transplant for those who are potential candidates.

The CILD has an established and dedicated team that includes specialized nurse coordinators, respiratory therapists, program coordinators, medical assistants and research coordinators. We cater to the needs of our patients, and we advocate for patient choices in clinical research studies for those wishing to participate.

The care team serves a broad range of patients in the Pacific Northwest and beyond, and they have experience managing parallel conditions, such as gastroesophageal reflux and pulmonary hypertension.

The CILD is recognized as a Center for Excellence by the Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation and Foundation of Sarcoidosis Network.

attributes.title: Lung Transplantation Services at UWMC

body.value:
Nationally recognized, team medicine approach to lung transplants

The lung transplant program at UW Medical Center was established in 1991 and is the only lung transplant program in the Pacific Northwest. The first lung transplant at UW Medicine was performed in 1992. Our team performs up to 60 transplants per year and has done nearly 1000 lung transplants.

We provide lung transplantation for a wide variety of patients including those with emphysema/COPD, pulmonary fibrosis and other interstitial lung diseases, cystic fibrosis, pulmonary hypertension, sarcoid, lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM), as well as other less common lung diseases. Combined lung transplantation with other organ transplantation (such as heart or liver) is also available if needed.

Our lung transplant program emphasizes a multidisciplinary team approach through all phases of the transplant process. This includes involvement from patients, their families and support persons, their communities and their community pulmonary physicians.

Recipients of a lung transplant receive lifelong care from the lung transplant team, which is comprised of specialists in pulmonary transplant medicine, thoracic surgery, rehabilitation medicine, nursing, pharmacy, nutrition, social work, laboratory medicine, radiology and pulmonary diagnostics. Additional specialty services are also available if needed.

Please contact our lung transplant team with questions. 

Pre-transplant: Phone: 206.598.5277/Fax: 206.598.3425

Post-transplant: Phone: 206.598.5668/Fax: 206.598.3856

attributes.title: Northwest Respiratory Associates

body.value:
Lung disease diagnosis, management and care at Northwest Hospital

Northwest Respiratory Associates is a pulmonary disease and critical care medicine practice on the Northwest Hospital campus.

Our care team consists of six board-certified physicians who specialize in the diagnosis and management of pulmonary (lung) diseases including COPD, adult asthma and emphysema, interstitial lung diseases and lung cancer.   

We work closely with you, your primary care physician and other specialists to help create an individualized, comprehensive care plan that meets your needs. We emphasize continuity of care, with cooperative involvement in the ongoing management of your healthcare with the goal of high-quality, cost-effective medical care. We also offer pulmonary function testing, bronchoscopy, including advanced techniques, and lung cancer screening.

attributes.title: Pulmonary Vascular Disease Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
State-of-the-art pulmonary vascular disease management at UW Medical Center

The Pulmonary Vascular Disease Clinic and program at UW Medical Center provides consultation, evaluation and treatment for a wide range of pulmonary vascular diseases. Experts in pulmonary vascular disease perform right-heart catheterization and advanced hemodynamic evaluation. The pulmonary vascular team works closely with experts in nuclear medicine, cardiac and chest imaging, thoracic surgery and interventional cardiology to understand each patient’s unique diagnosis and provide excellent care for diseases of the blood vessels in the lung.

UW Medicine has the only accredited, comprehensive pulmonary vascular care program in the region and is one of only a few programs in the country that is able to provide care for all aspects of pulmonary vascular care. This includes careful diagnostics, a full range of medications for pulmonary vascular disease, pulmonary hypertension care, pulmonary thromboendarterectomy, balloon pulmonary angioplasty and lung transplant.

We are also home to the national registry for patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension and are active in researching new treatments.

New patients, please call 206.598.2521 to schedule an appointment, then fax documents (including previous test results, pictures from previous lung scans or heart catheterizations) to 206.598.3621. Established patients, please call 206.598.7356 and fax documents to 206.598.3036.

attributes.title: Thoracic Surgery Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Surgical treatments for diseases of the lung, esophagus and chest

The Thoracic Surgery Clinic at Harborview Medical Center offers a comprehensive approach to the treatment of lung cancer and other thoracic malignancies, including tumors of the mediastinum, pleura, chest wall and esophagus.

The Harborview Thoracic Surgery Clinic also evaluates and manages a wide variety of benign thoracic diseases and conditions that can require surgical treatment, including pleural effusions and infections, pulmonary nodules, chest wall deformities, trauma and thoracic outlet syndrome. 

Our thoracic surgeons and clinic staff work closely with a broad range of specialists and providers across UW Medicine to ensure patients receive a multidisciplinary, personalized, contemporary approach—including video-assisted thoracic surgery (VATS)—in their evaluation and management. In conjunction with the Harborview mission, the Thoracic Surgery Clinic is also especially committed to ensuring that our region’s most vulnerable residents receive exemplary thoracic surgical care and services.

attributes.title: Thoracic Surgery Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Advanced surgical treatments for lung, esophagus and other chest cancers

The Thoracic Surgery Clinic at UW Medical Center offers a comprehensive approach to the prevention and treatment of all diseases of the chest, including lung and esophageal cancers, lung nodules, esophageal perforation, mediastinal tumors, pleural-based tumors and malignancies and chest wall deformities and trauma.

Our surgeons are recognized for providing the best care and results for our patients. They are some of the most experienced in using minimally invasive procedures and technologies, including video-assisted thoracic surgery (VATS) and robotic-assisted technology.

For our cancer patients, our thoracic surgeons work closely with medical and radiation oncologists to offer holistic care. The UW Medicine and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance lung cancer program includes prevention, early detection and surveillance and the most effective treatments available for those with a diagnosis. As part of treatment, patients may be eligible for clinical research trials and benefit from the breakthrough research of our partner, the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center.

Our goal is to provide personalized treatment, working with you and your family to present all available options, and to answer any questions about your condition.

attributes.title: Adult Cystic Fibrosis Clinic at UW Medical Center

body.value:
Comprehensive care and breakthrough cystic fibrosis research at UW Medical Center

The Adult Cystic Fibrosis Clinic and Program at UW Medical Center is the only adult CF Program in the Puget Sound region and offers the region’s only lung transplant program.

Our integrated approach includes multidisciplinary care, research and clinical trials to advance the science behind CF and extend the lives of our patients.

Our board-certified physicians specialize in cystic fibrosis, pulmonary disease and internal medicine. They work closely with registered nurses, dietitians, social workers, mental health providers, clinical pharmacists and respiratory therapists to provide a holistic, patient-centered approach.

We provide consultation, evaluation and care for cystic fibrosis, as well as pulmonary function tests, cystic fibrosis genotyping and specialty referrals for male infertility, diabetes, otolaryngology, allergy, high-risk obstetrics and others as indicated.

Thanks to a long-term partnership between the University of Washington and the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, one of the seven original CFF Therapeutic Network sites, our patients have benefitted from nearly 30 years of medical breakthroughs.

As part of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation-sponsored Research Development Program (RDP), the UW maintains core facilities for use by cystic fibrosis researchers, funds pilot research projects, sponsors research seminars and supports fellows involved in cystic fibrosis research.

attributes.title: Foot & Ankle Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Comprehensive foot and ankle care in the University District

Located at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt, ​​​the Foot & Ankle Center provides comprehensive orthopedic and musculoskeletal care, with an emphasis on returning patients to their normal life activities. 

Our services and care encompass both surgical and non-surgical treatments, including fracture care, ligament reconstruction, ankle arthroscopy, foot and ankle reconstruction, diabetic foot care and orthotics.

We partner with you to develop an individualized treatment plan that will provide the best outcome to help restore foot and ankle mobility and function.

attributes.title: Orthopedic Oncology Center at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Comprehensive care for tissue and bone cancers and tumors

Located in Seattle’s University District, the Orthopedic Oncology Center at UW Medical Center - Roosevelt provides consultation, diagnosis and treatment plans for patients with sarcomas (malignant tumors arising in connective tissue and bone) and benign soft tissue or bony tumors.

With an emphasis on providing clear patient communications, our team of specialty-trained orthopedic surgeons, physician assistants and nurses partner with oncologists, radiologists, radiation specialists and other healthcare professionals to provide a careful, yet aggressive approach to tumor diagnosis, imaging and treatment, including surgery.

attributes.title: The Sports Medicine Clinic at Ballard

body.value:
Complete care in Ballard for sports- and work-related injuries

Located in Seattle’s Ballard neighborhood, The Sports Medicine Clinic successfully treats a comprehensive list of muscle and joint problems and sports- or workplace-related injuries with surgical and non-surgical techniques.

Our team consists of physicians working in primary care, sports medicine, physical medicine and rehabilitation, along with orthopedic surgeons, podiatric surgeons and physical therapists.

Whether you come to us after an accident, injury, illness or surgery, we help you regain strength and relieve pain so you can return to your daily and recreational activities.

Located in Seattle’s Ballard neighborhood, the care team at the Hip & Knee Center diagnoses, treats and rehabilitates patients with both simple and complex hip and knee joint disorders. We welcome all patients, whether you suffer chronic pain, discomfort or deformity, or if arthritis or injuries have impacted your active lifestyle.

We offer rehabilitation therapy, manage complex total joint problems and realign knee structure. Additional advanced services are available at other UW Medicine Hip & Knee Center locations.

attributes.title: Prosthetics and Orthotics Clinic at Eastlake

body.value:
Consultation, design and fit for your stability and mobility needs

The Prosthetics and Orthotics Clinic provides spinal and upper and lower limb orthoses and prostheses to help patients recover from a lost limb, debilitating injury or disease. Patients are seen in our Eastlake Clinic or at Harborview in the Maleng Building on the 4th floor.

An orthosis is a brace that increases the stability of the spine or extremity. A prosthesis is an artificial limb that replaces an arm or a leg. We offer comprehensive consultation and custom design of orthotic and prosthetic devices to restore function and promote healing.

Our team of American Board certified prosthetists, orthotists, pedorthists, and orthotic fitters will craft prosthetic and orthotic solutions to address your unique mobility needs. We will work with you and your rehabilitation team to provide custom orthotics and prosthetics to meet the demands of everyday life and for specialized activity use.

The Prosthetics and Orthotics Clinic is also set up for texting. Text the clinic at 206.598.4026.

attributes.title: Sports Medicine Center at Husky Stadium

body.value:
Sports medicine care at Husky Stadium for people of all ages and abilities

The Sports Medicine Center at Husky Stadium is an ultramodern, 30,000 square-foot facility located on the UW campus.

Our providers work with people of all ages and abilities, including athletes and non-athletes alike. We have specialists in sports medicine, orthopedic surgery, physical therapy and radiology, offering a full range of sports medicine services.

Our staff includes team physicians for the UW Huskies, Seattle Seahawks, various Seattle public high schools and the Seattle Marathon. They’ll work with you —and others involved in your care—to assess and resolve your injuries and health concerns.

attributes.title: General Surgery at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
General surgical evaluations and treatments on the eastside

The general surgery team at Eastside Specialty Center in Bellevue offers a range of evaluation and surgical treatment services. Our experienced, board-certified physicians and staff treat patients as unique individuals, each with their own health needs and life goals.

We perform general surgical procedures, including hernia, colorectal and endocrine surgeries. 

Our highly-qualified care team also treats a variety of conditions including gallbladder disease, hemorrhoids and anal fissures, hernia, lipomas, gastric esophageal reflux disease, pilonidal sinuses and many other surgical problems.

attributes.title: General Pulmonary Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Advanced care for COPD and difficult-to-diagnose lung diseases

The General Pulmonary Clinic at UWMC provides consultation and evaluation for patients with pulmonary and respiratory-related diseases, such as asthma, emphysema, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), asbestosis, lung cancer, sarcoidosis, pulmonary fibrosis, sleep disorders and other lung-related diseases. We also evaluate appropriate patients for lung volume reduction surgery, lung transplantation and pulmonary rehabilitation.

The clinic has subspecialty clinics for the specific diagnoses of cystic fibrosis, sleep disorders, neuromuscular diseases, interstitial lung diseases and pulmonary artery hypertension.

The wide array of pulmonary procedures offered includes complete pulmonary function testing (spirometry), 6-minute walk testing, high-altitude simulation testing, cardiopulmonary exercise testing, arterial blood gases, thoracentesis, fiber optic bronchoscopy and referrals to surgery and transplantation.

Please note: We see patient in clinic on Tuesdays and Fridays from 8 a.m.-12 p.m. and Wednesdays from 1-5 p.m., but patient calls are accepted Monday through Friday from 8 a.m.-5 p.m.

attributes.title: Orthopedics at Eastside Specialty Center
Endocrinology/Diabetes Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Complete care at Harborview for patients with diabetes and endocrine conditions

The Endocrinology/Diabetes Clinic at Harborview Medical Center cares for patients by offering evaluation, management and education for people with type 1 or 2 diabetes, endocrine diseases (thyroid, adrenal, pituitary, lipid and gonads), dyslipidemia and obesity.

We also offer same day thyroid fine needle biopsy for those patients being evaluated for thyroid nodules.

Patient care includes a care coordinator who accesses resources, schedules appointments and addresses financial and insurance concerns; certified diabetic education nurses who provide diabetes education, management and support; registered dietitians who offer patient education, counseling and support for dietary needs regarding specific diagnoses; and social workers who assist with community resources and emotional and financial support.

Harborview's Patient and Family Resource Center also offers classes and resources to help you manage chronic conditions, especially diabetes. Patients also can access the full services of UW Medicine for other specialty services or hospitalization needs.

attributes.title: Lipid Clinic Northwest at Harborview

body.value:
Complete care for patients with high cholesterol and related conditions

Lipid Clinic Northwest at Harborview Medical Center cares for patients with high cholesterol and blood fats, a condition known as hyperlipidemia. We provide advanced management of lipid disorders and related metabolic and endocrine problems, including the evaluation and management of hyperlipidemia, heart disease risk and related health problems. We also provide lipid apheresis for people who are dealing with otherwise unmanageable hypercholesterolemia/hyperlipidemia.

We offer patients laboratory testing, diet assessment and education and physical examinations to diagnose the origin and/or cause of lipid and related abnormalities and to assess heart disease risk factors; individualized risk management through diet and medication; and consultation for primary care providers on specific cases. We have a registered dietitian with special expertise in cholesterol and lipoprotein metabolism providing patient education on-site.  

We handle prescriptions for established patients on a daily basis, and we also perform research activities for interested patients outside regularly scheduled clinic appointment hours.

attributes.title: Weight Regulation Diagnostic and Evaluation Center at Harborview

body.value:
Weight-regulation disorder management and expertise at Harborview

The Weight Regulation Diagnostic and Evaluation Center at Harborview provides evaluation, diagnosis, management and education for patients of all ages with disorders of weight regulation, including patients with diabetes, hypertension or heart disease complicated by excessive weight gain and obesity. 

Our physicians and other care providers have expertise in weight regulation and place emphasis on an integrated approach, requiring lifestyle modifications including diet and physical activity to minimize complications from these conditions and enhance health, wellbeing and activities of daily life. Treatment plans may also include pharmacologic therapy and referral for bariatric surgery when appropriate. 

Services provided at this clinic include assessments, dietitian-assisted evaluations and education, individualized exercise programs developed by physical therapists, coordination of medical care and access to healthcare. The full services of UW Medicine are also available for other specialty services or hospitalization.

attributes.title: Neuro-Rehabilitation Program at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Outpatient physical, occupational and speech language services treating neurological conditions, injuries

The Neuro-Rehabilitation Program at Northwest Hospital provides comprehensive outpatient treatment services for people ages 17 and older with various neurologic conditions, including multiple sclerosis, Parkinson’s disease, traumatic brain injury, stroke, tumor and ALS.  

Our services include speech language pathology for improving communication, memory, attention, swallow dysfunction, voice disorders and other cognitive skills, and occupational therapy and physical therapy for improving independent daily tasks like meal preparation, household management, balance, ambulation, dizziness, flexibility, strength, fall prevention, and wheelchair seating and evaluations.

Our team focuses on improving independence in the home and the ability to return to functional activities, like work or school. Treatment addresses cognitive, physical and emotional/behavioral changes related to brain injury or neurological disorders through individual and, in some cases, group formats.

Patients can practice functional skills in our Easy Street® environment, a life-sized replica of a city street, including a grocery store, restaurant, movie theater and home with a kitchen, dining room bedroom and car. Easy Street allows patients an optional setting for rehabilitative care so that they can improve their mobility, functionality and confidence in real-life environments through activities rather than exercise.

attributes.title: Physical Therapy Clinic at Northwest Outpatient Medical Center

body.value:
Injury and surgery-recovery therapy services in North Seattle

Northwest Hospital’s Outpatient Physical Therapy Services at the Outpatient Medical Center is a premier orthopedic physical therapy clinic offering the highest quality care and treatment to patients in the greater Seattle area.

Conveniently located just west of the Northgate Mall on Meridian Avenue, our clinic offers a team of orthopedic, sports and manual therapy specialists who provide leading-edge skills in assessment and evidence-based treatment planning.

These therapists provide one-on-one patient-centered care that will facilitate patient’s recovery from injuries and surgeries to the knee, hip, neck, back, hand, wrist, elbow, shoulder and ankle. Our practitioners also specialize in unique PT treatments to address pelvic health, vestibular dysfunction, vertigo, BPPV, and hand/upper extremity therapy. The team has expertise in geriatrics, osteoporosis, fall prevention, balance improvement and specific overuse syndromes.

attributes.title: Physical, Occupational and Speech Therapy Services at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Comprehensive physical and occupational therapies and speech language services in North Seattle

Physical and Occupational and Speech Language Therapy Services at Northwest Hospital provides patient-centered care surrounding your return to the activity you love. 

Our highly experienced and educated team will examine and evaluate your needs and provide a detailed plan on how to achieve all of your goals.

The services include outpatient physical, occupational and speech therapy for those with MS or who have suffered from a neurological event such as stroke or head injury. Our practitioners specialize in unique treatments to address residual deficits often associated with neurological conditions, such as weakness, balance, swallowing and/or cognitive impairments. Specialty programs include treatment for vestibular balance disorders, oncology rehabilitation, fall prevention, lymphedema and voice disorders. 

The Physical Therapy phone number is 206 668 1915; the Occupational Therapy phone number is 206 668 1838; the Speech Therapy phone number: 206 668 1848.

attributes.title: Infectious Disease & Travel Medicine Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Infectious disease care and travel medicine preparation at Harborview 

The Infectious Disease Clinic at Harborview Medical Center evaluates and treats patients 16 years and older for the entire spectrum of infectious diseases. These include endocarditis; osteomyelitis; post-operative infections; skin and soft tissue infections; extrapulmonary tuberculosis and other mycobacterial infections; fever of unknown origin; and infections following overseas travel (including tropical infections).

Our board-certified infectious disease physicians work closely with specialists throughout the center to provide thorough, patient-centered care.

We also provide complete pretravel counseling, evaluations and immunizations if you’re planning on traveling outside of North America. We’re a Washington State Department of Health-authorized provider for yellow fever vaccine. We recommend making a pretravel clinic appointment four to six weeks before your departure to allow for appropriate timing of vaccines.

Our services include physical exam, lab testing, treatment, patient education and pre- and post-travel evaluations, including immunizations and malaria prevention.

attributes.title: Infectious Diseases & Tropical Medicine Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Infectious disease care and post-travel medical treatments at UWMC

The Infectious Diseases and Tropical Medicine Clinic at the University of Washington Medical Center provides comprehensive care for patients with bacterial, viral, and parasitic and fungal infections.

Commonly treated infections include skin and soft tissue infections, including MRSA; bloodstream infections and endocarditis; bone and joint infections; lung and sinus infections; recurrent or complicated urinary tract infections (UTI); extrapulmonary tuberculosis (TB); infections following overseas travel; infections due to primary immunodeficiencies; zoonotic (animal-associated) infections; infections in patients with certain forms of cancer; and infections in solid organ transplant patients, both pre- and post-transplant.

We also provide consultation on the prevention of infectious diseases, and follow-up care including intravenous antibiotic management for patients following hospitalization.

HIV infection, viral hepatitis, and infections in stem cell transplant patients are cared for in other UWMC Clinics.

We provide consultative services to other healthcare providers in the WWAMI (Washington, Wyoming, Alaska, Montana and Idaho) region; patient self-referral is discouraged.
